title: K8s Exodus: Simplification Wave Creates Deploy-Tool Opportunity
thesis: Developer teams are actively migrating away from Kubernetes to simpler deployment solutions like Kamal and Docker Compose. The primary driver is cost reduction (70%+ savings reported) and complexity reduction (90%+ reported). This creates opportunities in the deployment simplification tooling space.
strategy: Build or invest in deployment abstraction tools that offer K8s-like reliability with Docker Compose-like simplicity. Target mid-size teams (10-50 engineers) who adopted K8s prematurely. Key differentiators: zero-config deployments, built-in monitoring, and one-click rollbacks.
risk_factors: Large enterprises with dedicated platform teams unlikely to migrate
Kubernetes ecosystem continues to improve developer experience
Market may consolidate around 1-2 winners quickly

evidence.author: cloudarch
evidence.snippet: Replaced entire K8s setup with Docker Compose + Kamal. 70% cost reduction.

evidence.author: devbuilder
evidence.snippet: Migration friction with custom loaders indicates tooling gap opportunity

friction_detail: Primary friction in K8s ecosystem: operational complexity, cost overhead for small/medium teams, steep learning curve. Teams report 90% complexity reduction after migration, suggesting K8s is significantly over-engineered for most use cases.
opportunity_window: 6-12 months. The simplification trend is accelerating but no dominant alternative has emerged yet. Early movers in the 'simple deployment' space can capture significant market share before consolidation.

blueprint.product_concept: A CLI tool that auto-converts Kubernetes YAML manifests into Docker Compose + Kamal configurations. Scan an existing K8s deployment, generate equivalent simple deployment configs, highlight incompatibilities, and provide a migration checklist. One command to go from K8s to simple.

mvp_weeks.goal: Core YAML parser and Docker Compose output
tasks: Build K8s YAML parser for Deployments, Services, ConfigMaps
Map K8s resources to Docker Compose equivalents
Handle environment variables and secrets mapping
Generate migration checklist with manual steps
Build interactive CLI with progress indicators
Launch on Hacker News and Reddit r/devops
Post Show HN with benchmark results
Set up feedback collection and analytics
Begin building hosted version with monitoring dashboard

blueprint.monetization: Freemium: CLI is free and open source for single-project conversions. Pro tier at $29/mo for teams: batch conversion, CI/CD integration, monitoring dashboard, and rollback support. Enterprise tier at $199/mo for audit logging and SSO.
blueprint.estimated_tam: ~500K teams currently running Kubernetes. If 10% of small/mid teams (50K) are considering simplification, and 5% convert at $29/mo = $870K ARR addressable in year 1.
